faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the Wplace Color Converter

items.question: What image formats does the color converter support?
items.answer: Our color converter supports PNG, JPG, JPEG, and WebP formats. You can upload images of any size, and the color converter will automatically process them using Wplace's color palette.

items.question: Is the Wplace Color Converter free to use?
items.answer: Yes! Our color converter is completely free to use. There are no hidden costs, subscriptions, or limitations on the number of images you can convert to Wplace colors.

items.question: How does the color size slider work?
items.answer: The color size slider controls how large each color block appears in your final artwork. Smaller values (1-8) create more detailed color patterns, while larger values (16-32) create more abstract, blocky designs using Wplace's color palette.

items.question: Are my images safe and private?
items.answer: Absolutely! All image processing happens in your browser. Your images never leave your device or get uploaded to our servers. Your privacy is our top priority.

items.question: What's the difference between small and large download options?
items.answer: The small version is color-perfect at the exact size you created, ideal for digital use. The large version is scaled up for better visibility and printing, while maintaining the Wplace color palette aesthetic.

items.question: Can I use the result directly in Wplace?
items.answer: Yes. The converter uses the official Wplace palette, so your downloads are fully compatible with Wplace projects.

items.question: What other Wplace tools are available?
items.answer: Beyond our color converter, we offer a comprehensive suite of Wplace tools. Visit our main Wplace Pixel homepage to discover our complete pixel art generator, advanced grid planning tools, and other professional features designed to enhance your Wplace.live experience.
